definition: first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
variant of 確|确[que4]/variant of 埆[que4]
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: I think they are the party's correct line of the faithful follower.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他们是党的正确路线的忠实执行者。

sentences.english: Is this the right line to Leicester Square?
sentences.chinese: 这是否往列斯广场的正确路线？

sentences.english: Belt noise can be minimised by correct alignment and adjustment, but not eliminated.
sentences.chinese: 带噪声可以最小的正确路线和调整，但并没有消除。

sentences.english: If you can't see the right path from your current location, go out and explore.
sentences.chinese: 如果你从当前位置看不到正确路线，走出去探索。

definition: leftist opportunism (blamed for failures of Chinese communists from 1927)/left adventurism/cf Mao's purges following 1935 Zunyi conference 遵義會議|遵义会议[Zun1 yi4 hui4 yi4]
pinyin: zuo3 qing1 ji1 hui4 zhu3 yi4

definition: Zunyi conference of January 1935 before the Long March

pinyin: Ma3 ke4 si1 Lie4 ning2 zhu3 yi4

definition: adventurism (a left-wing error against Mao's line during the 1930s)
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
the mass line, CCP term for Party policy aimed at broadening and cultivating contacts with the masses
the (communist) party and the army together (idiom)
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
